name: Bruce Fortune
description: Managed the Equipment Stores Warehouse and supply inventory with responsibility for warehouse, tool room, contract management, inventory control system administration and management of the fuel and surplus vehicle programs; supervised four staff who purchase, receive and store supplies, tools and materials; developed, implemented and scrutinized warehouse policy, procedures and operations to ensure compliance with financial, purchasing and industry standards/regulations and to ensure the safe and efficient handling and storage of materials; reviewed and approved credit card purchases of staff; monitored payment of invoices; formulated blanket purchase orders; developed the budget and monitoring costs for the fuel program; ensured the security of all materials, supplies and tools; tracked the sale of surplus vehicles; maintained accounting records for auditing purposes; developed specifications for RFP’s and participated in the selection of supply vendors and service contractors; monitored the performance of contractors to ensure compliance with contract specifications; planned and conducted annual inventories; developed and monitored inventory control systems; oversaw the operation of the computerized fuel dispensing and usage documentation system; ensured staff’s adherence to fuel stabilization and additive standards, underground storage tank standards, and vapor recovery requirements; managed the warranties for automotive parts and components; consummated and monitored performance measures and provides program management reports and records

NJ
07960

name: Bruce Fortune
description: Procured goods and services, such as raw materials, equipment, tools, parts, and supplies for maintenance and renovation projects; conferred with vendors to obtain product or service information, including price, availability, and delivery schedule; determined method of procurement, either as direct purchase or bid; prepared purchase orders or bid requests; reviewed bid proposals and negotiated contracts within budgetary limitations and scope of authority; processed invoices for payment; liaised with Accounts Payable and vendors to ensure accurate and timely payment of invoices as necessary for the business with the supplier; maintained computerized procurement records, such as items or services purchased, costs, delivery, and inventories; generated requisitions; received, stored and distributed purchased material; processed receiving documents and maintained files; responsible for complete management of inventory; managed, completed and analyzed fixed asset inventories; reviewed and adjusted inventory control criteria to meet objectives; performed biannual inventory and cycle counting program, to include conducting random checks, and recommending improvements to balance inventory; maintained good working relationships with vendors/suppliers; assisted with the development of bid tabulations and requests for quotations (RFQs)

title: Materials Specialist III
name: Bruce Fortune
description: Received and processed inbound/outbound freight; provided critical shipping guidance during outages (defined as periods of shutdown involving significant repair/overhaul) to ensure equipment is shipped to facilities for timely repair while maintaining strict budgetary considerations; requisitions specialist; inspected freight for compliance with purchase order specifications, led team members in purchase order process; established/maintained inventory process, including reports and paperwork, verifying contents and quantities, inspecting, determining storage location, preparing for storage or delivery; purchased material, equipment, and supplies from vendors; solicited bids from vendors for stock and non-stock material and equipment to analyze costs and lead time to maintain current stocking levels and to meet projected/scheduled repairs during both normal operations and major outages; created and continually monitored weekly compliance schedule for the submission of solicitations for bids and requests for quotations to prevent inventory stock outs to enhance departmental and plant efficiency; utilized sales forecasts to procure fast moving and seasonal items to obtain maximum discounts; ensured all procurement documentation complied with policies and procedures; performed monthly inventory counts; devised a specific location system to accurately and efficiently identify inventory for monthly cycle counts, resulting in greater accuracy and reduced count time; performed initial analysis of interior and exterior warehouse storage system, confirming significant loss of cubic storage space; implemented a new storage system maximizing space and minimizing retrieval time by consolidating like material; operated a LPG powered or electric forklift; coordinated, expedited and arranged flow of material, parts, and assemblies in accordance with specific job orders or priorities; ensured certification of hazardous materials (HAZMET) for transporting, tracing, and clearing

title: Parts Advisor

name: Bruce Fortune
description: Manager of automotive dealership parts department; eliminated on-hand quantity discrepancies of fastest moving inventory by devising and instituting automated billing system to download parts; reduced retrieval time 50% by performing location analysis to identify top 300 fastest moving parts; eliminated keypunch errors 100% by initiating use of download capability, thereby facilitating and expediting parts order submissions to manufacturers; increased gross profit 20% by negotiating a reduction of inter-dealership parts acquisition cost from 25% to 10%; reduced physical inventory from three days to one by creating a bin allocation system; increased sales 12% by analyzing wholesale market potential; minimized slow-moving/obsolete inventory by submitting obsolescence returns to manufacturers; established market driven pricing policies; prepared sales forecasts and analyzed financial results; calculated and monitored control supply sources to optimize inventory levels using statistical models to design minimum, maximum and best reorder levels; formulated and evaluated criteria for new stock Assistant Parts Manager: Generated annual sales averaging $1.6 million; programmed terminals to invoice frequently recurring tasks with one-touch keystroke; conducted routine system maintenance and software updates; served as technical resource for external and in-house consumers; provided continuous departmental guidance and maintained reference resources; established records of parts modifications and part number changes; maintained current parts and service information files

name: Kevjn Lim
description: Researched, analyzed and published on political, security and geostrategic issues in the Middle East; Coordinated team research consultancy projects driven by monthly client field intelligence requirements (for Crisis Action). Open Briefing is the world’s first civil society intelligence agency; an accessible platform for insight and analysis on key defence, security and foreign policy issues. We provide open source intelligence assessments and independent security briefings, so that a better informed civil society can properly engage with peace and security debates and influence positive policy developments in these areas. It’s the think tank that’s a little bit different.

name: Kevjn Lim
description: • Delegate, Kabul, 2011 Field operations for central provinces (Logar, Wardak, Ghazni) and Loya Paktia in the southeast (Khost, Paktia, Paktika) • Rapid Assessment Team Leader, Libya Arab Jamahiriyya May-June 2011, Tripoli etc Undertook exploratory expedition to the Fezzan and cities along the Gulf of Sirt within vicinity of contemporaneous frontline fighting; carried out and collated humanitarian assessments and monitored actual and potential protection concerns linked to all parties to the conflict; established contacts with political/security actors in the various Popular Congresses; linked up with the Libyan Red Crescent Society • Regional Tracing Delegate, Kurdistan-Iraq, 2010–2011 Oversaw wide range of tracing activities in Northern Iraq and the disputed areas Kirkuk & Mosul, with prime focus on the (contemporary) Missing file and allegations of arrest; carried out visits to foreigners and foreign non-state actors in detention; networked with both Iraqi governmental and non-state actors; maintained operational ties with Iraqi Red Cresecent Society • Field Delegate, Al-Geneina, West Darfur, Sudan, 2008–2009 Field/security coordination for areas south of Al-Geneina; monitored-analyzed-reported on patterns of intertribal violence; oversaw family reunification of child soldiers; conceptualized-implemented-monitored economic security and intertribal reconciliation projects including MEIs, seeds-and-tools, livestock vaccination, first-aid training, while focussing on tribal land tenure issues; networked among tribal leaders • Protection Delegate, Hebron/Ramallah, West Bank, 2007–2008 Monitored and documented protection concerns; carried out humanitarian diplomacy with both the Civil Administration and the Palestinian Authority; visited and followed up on persons detained under the PA; coordinated for ambulance evacuations; focused on the adverse effects of seam zones throughout Hebron district and in Masafer Yatta in particular
